channel.title: Port 43594
channel.description:
Hey guys, so I tried to open port 43594, but it still doesn't work.
These are the steps I took:
I opened my Firewall I went to Advanced Settings I went to Inbound Rules I clicked "New Rule" I clicked the "Port" box I clicked Next I clicked TCP and entered port 43594 I clicked Next I clicked Allow the Connection I clicked all of the buttons for where it will be allowed to come from Private, Public, Domain I entered my RSPS name and clicked apply I went to "Allowed Programs" to check if it was there It was there and it was set on Private and Public I checked to see if the port was open and the porter check said it wasn't
Can anybody help me? I don't know what to do!

item.title: Port 43594
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

Shorty626:

Well then that is your problem. If you are unable to forward a connection request to your server, there is no way for anyone to connect to it from the outside.

wrong, hamachi.

The problem is usually a router, not your ISP. If you have a router on your network then any attempted server connections would come to your router and go crap, which computer do i send it too? i don’t know so i just throw it out.(CLOSED)
The purpose of port forwarding is to get it to send data from that port to a certain “host”(your server)

Read full topic

item.title: Port 43594
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

Actually I think that’s the problem, that there is no TCP/UDP setting. There are things like DNS, FTP, and some other random stuff. But no TCP/UDP. I found my router on Portforward.com, and followed this tutorial

http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/Samsung/SCH-LC11/defaultguide.htm

Does anybody know any other way I could portforward, or can somebody PLEASE help me over teamviewer or skype? I am just completely lost and out of ideas!

Read full topic

item.title: Port 43594
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“b00mz1029, post:9, topic:525153”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=643845.msg4333511#msg4333511 date=1373999182]
“My ISP doesn’t allow me to port forward properly.” You just answered your own question, you cannot do it since your ISP blocks you from doing so. By the looks of things you did everything correctly. Just make sure you’re running the server when you test to see if the port is open.
[/quote]
Well, is there any other way to portforward? Or could you help me figure out if it truly is impossible to portforward on my isp. Because there is a Port Forward location. As shown on the thread I posted earlier.[/quote]

Use google and search around for what ports your ISP allows you to use.

Read full topic

item.title: Port 43594
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

Jmood:

“My ISP doesn’t allow me to port forward properly.” You just answered your own question, you cannot do it since your ISP blocks you from doing so. By the looks of things you did everything correctly. Just make sure you’re running the server when you test to see if the port is open.

Well, is there any other way to portforward? Or could you help me figure out if it truly is impossible to portforward on my isp. Because there is a Port Forward location. As shown on the thread I posted earlier.

Read full topic

item.title: Port 43594
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

Hey guys, so I tried to open port 43594, but it still doesn’t work.

These are the steps I took:

I opened my Firewall
I went to Advanced Settings
I went to Inbound Rules
I clicked “New Rule”
I clicked the “Port” box
I clicked Next
I clicked TCP and entered port 43594
I clicked Next
I clicked Allow the Connection
I clicked all of the buttons for where it will be allowed to come from Private, Public, Domain
I entered my RSPS name and clicked apply
I went to “Allowed Programs” to check if it was there
It was there and it was set on Private and Public
I checked to see if the port was open and the porter check said it wasn’t

Can anybody help me? I don’t know what to do!

Read full topic
